instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923A: What is 820-00923A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message: Hello!, got this board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which has short on <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL>. Removed <TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR> to find that pad were burnt, but even with <TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR> removed there still was short. Later tried removing these components to solve short problem: <TRANSISTOR>Q7065</TRANSISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7051</CAPACITOR>, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C7053</CAPACITOR>, <RESISTOR>R7060</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7069</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7064</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7066</CAPACITOR>, but not luck finding short. Anything i'm missing or pads on <TRANSISTOR>Q7040</TRANSISTOR> busted? Thank you in advice for help üôè

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message:
Very likely short between copper layers.
As nothing to lose, you can try polishing the border of the hole.
